alert.note: Alert for Boone; Gallatin; Grant; Kenton; Owen (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 28 at 12:15AM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF EAST CENTRAL SWITZERLAND...SOUTHERN KENTON...SOUTHERN BOONE... NORTHWESTERN GRANT...NORTH CENTRAL OWEN AND GALLATIN COUNTIES THROUGH 1245 AM EDT... At 1214 AM EDT, a strong thunderstorm was located over Warsaw, moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph, half inch hail, frequent cloud-to-ground lightning, and very heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Hail may cause minor damage to vegetation. Lightning can cause serious injury or death. Visibility will be poor and hydroplaning is possible. Locations impacted include... Williamstown, Walton, Crittenden, Dry Ridge, Warsaw, Florence, Kentucky Speedway, Glencoe, Sparta, Patriot, Stewartsville, Ryle, Interstate 71 at US Route 127, Steele Bottom, Bracht, Egypt Bottom, Elliston, Ethridge, Munk, and Eagle Hill. This includes the following Interstates... I-71 in Kentucky between mile markers 54 and 74. I-75 in Kentucky between mile markers 162 and 171. If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a sturdy building. Motorists should slow down and use extra caution. When thunder roars, go indoors! Do not stay in the open or seek shelter under trees when lightning threatens. To report hazardous weather conditions, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
